rev.diff:
Line 15: Line 15:
Some computers, particularly older ones, may not have a [[BIOS]] that supports USB booting. In this case a computer can often be "redirected" to boot from a USB device through use of a bootable CD or [[floppy disk]].
Some computers, particularly older ones, may not have a [[BIOS]] that supports USB booting. In this case a computer can often be "redirected" to boot from a USB device through use of a bootable CD or [[floppy disk]].
  +
Due to the additional read/write cycles that occur on a full blown install, the life of your flash drive may be slightly reduced.
==History==
==History==
*Proposed by IBM in [[2004]], in the papers "Reincarnating PCs with Portable SoulPads" ([http://domino.watson.ibm.com/library/cyberdig.nsf/papers/577BB6B4F4A4BB7185256FF0004E578A/ PDF] & [http://www.research.ibm.com/WearableComputing/SoulPad/soulpad.html Summary]) and [http://www-128.ibm.com/developerworks/linux/library/l-fireboot.html Boot Linux from a FireWire device]
*Proposed by IBM in [[2004]], in the papers "Reincarnating PCs with Portable SoulPads" ([http://domino.watson.ibm.com/library/cyberdig.nsf/papers/577BB6B4F4A4BB7185256FF0004E578A/ PDF] & [http://www.research.ibm.com/WearableComputing/SoulPad/soulpad.html Summary]) and [http://www-128.ibm.com/developerworks/linux/library/l-fireboot.html Boot Linux from a FireWire device]
